learning_objectives.description: Simplify expressions by collecting like terms.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Simplify means give the answer in its simplest form, e.g. 2a² + 3ab − 1 + 5a² – 9ab + 4 = 7a² – 6ab + 3.
e.g. expand 3x(2x – 4y), (3x + y)(x – 4y). Includes products of more than two brackets, e.g. expand (x - 2)(x + 3)(2x + 1).

learning_objectives.description: Factorise expressions of the form: ax + bx + kay + kby, a²x² - b²y², a² + 2ab + b², ax² + bx + c, ax³ + bx² + cx.
Complete the square for expressions in the form ax² + bx + c.
